manualSteps.content: 1. Soak dried vegetables and dried shiitake mushrooms in hot water (200ml) for 30 minutes.
2. Put soaked rice, konjac rice, soaked dried vegetables, and water (100ml) in a rice cooker and press the cooking button to cook rice.
3. Put the soaked shiitake mushrooms in a pan that is chopped and heated over medium heat, add minced pork, soy sauce (5g), and sesame oil (2g) and stir-fry them for 3 minutes to take out.
4. Put cooking oil (3ml) on another pan heated over medium heat and add eggs to make scrambled eggs.
5. Blanch the Cham greens in boiling water (300ml) for 1 minute, rinse them in cold water, and mix them with salt (1g), soy sauce (2g), and sesame oil (1g).
6. Put chwinamul konjac rice in a bowl and put roasted mushrooms, meat, scrambled eggs, and seasoned Chamnamul on top.

rcpPartsDtls: [2 servings] Chicken (1), onion (1), green onion (1), water parsley (½ zoom), pine mushroom (3), enoki mushroom (1 bag), garlic (6 pages), mushroom (4), egg (1), starch (0.7 Ts), soy sauce (0.5 Ts), salt (0.3 ts), pepper powder (slightly)
rcpNaTip: •The broth with onions, green onions, and water parsley gave it a non-irritating taste.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash the chicken clean and prepare it, and divide the onion and green onion into quarters.
2. Cut the mushroom into thick pieces in shape, cut the enoki mushroom at the base and cut it into pieces, and cut the water parsley into bite-sized pieces.
3. Put the chicken in a pot and pour enough water to soak, add onions, green onions, water parsley (½ content), and garlic, raise it to a high heat, and boil it until the chicken is cooked.
4. Take out the chicken, onion, and water parsley, cool it down, and then remove the meat from the chicken.
5. Mix chicken, onion, remaining water parsley, eggs, and starch evenly to make chicken balls.
6. Add chicken balls, mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, mushrooms, and leftover water parsley to the broth, season with seasoning, and boil it a little to finish.

rcpPartsDtls:
• Essential ingredients: chicken meat (90g), green onion (10g), radish (70g), onion (20g), red pepper (5g), garlic (3g), cheongyang red pepper (5g)
•Boiled ingredients: chicken bone (200g), kelp (3g), green onion (5g), garlic (2g), water (600g)
•Seasoning: Pepper (5g)
rcpNaTip: •We made a thick broth with chicken bones and vegetables to lower the sodium content.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash the chicken meat and chicken bones thoroughly, add water, garlic, green onions, and kelp, and boil the broth.
2. When the chicken meat is cooked, take it out and tear it into small pieces.
3. Slice radishes, slice green onions, red peppers, and cheongyang peppers at an angle, and chop onions and garlic.
4. When the broth comes out, strain the broth through a sieve.
5. Stir-fry garlic in a pot, add chicken, stir-fry it together, add stock and trimmed vegetables, and boil it.
6. Season with pepper to finish.

rcpPartsDtls: [2 servings] Eggplants (1), cucumbers (1), rice (400g), salt (0.4 ts), kelp powder (2 ts), plum vinegar (2 ts), sesame oil (2 ts), sesame seeds (2 ts)
rcpNaTip: •I used kelp powder instead of salt to reduce sodium intake and add umami.

manualSteps.content: 1. Slice eggplants and cucumbers vertically.
2. Pickle the sliced cucumbers in salt (0.2ts) for 10 minutes and squeeze out the water.
3. Place the sliced eggplant on a dry pan heated over low heat and bake it back and forth until golden.
4. Add the remaining seasoning to the rice and mix evenly.
5. Put rice together in bite-sized pieces on salted cucumbers and roasted eggplant.
6. Roll it up and finish it in a bowl.

rcpPartsDtls:
80g beef corgi, 40g saesongi mushrooms, 4g flour, 1g pine nuts.
[Ddeokgalbi seasoning] 5g soy sauce, 5g pear juice, 5g onion juice, 4g honey, 5g minced green onions, 3g minced garlic, 1g sesame salt, 1g sesame oil, 1g pepper powder
rcpNaTip: Pine powder must be used in a soft way by laying paper or paper towels.

manualSteps.content: 1. Finely chop beef.
2. Add the marinade of tteokgalbi to the minced beef and season it evenly.
3. Cut the pine mushroom into 1.5cm wide and 6cm long and coat it with flour.
4. Make tteokgalbi by wrapping 2 on 3 with 1cm left on top and bottom of mushrooms.
5. Bake in pan not to burn back and forth.
6. Sprinkle with pine nuts.

rcpPartsDtls: Spinach 10g, carrot 15g, flour 50g, water 10g, potato 10g, zucchini 15g, shilpa 5g, anchovy stock 200g, minced garlic 2g, soy sauce 2g, salt 1g
rcpNaTip: If you want a soft dough, make the sujebi dough thinner and put it on a spatula and cut it.

manualSteps.content: 1. Add water to each mix of spinach and carrots.
2. Divide the flour in half, add spinach juice and carrot juice, add salt, and knead each.
3. Make the dough of 2 into a round shape of about 1.5cm in diameter.
4. Cut the potatoes and zucchini into 1.5cm dice and cut the yarns into 2cm lengths.
5. Put potatoes, sujebi dumplings, zucchini, minced garlic, and shilpa in anchovy stock and boil them.
6. Season 5 with soy sauce and salt.

rcpPartsDtls: 40g beef, 6g pork, 15g onion, 10g pear, 5g garlic, 2g ginger, 3g soy sauce, 5g sticky rice powder, 2g sesame oil, 5g sesame seeds
rcpNaTip: I used soy sauce instead of salt to reduce sodium.

manualSteps.content: 1. Finely chop the meat and peel the vegetables.
2. Grate the pear for juice, mince the onion, and stir-fry it lightly in an ungreased pan.
3. Finely grind garlic and ginger, mix them with pear juice, and put them in minced meat.
4. Season the rib patties with soy sauce and sesame oil, and add glutinous rice powder to stick them together.
5. Make it into a round shape and lightly press the middle to bake in an oiled pan.
6. Bake in an oven at 170°C for about 3 minutes and cook to the core.

rcpPartsDtls: 30g kelp, 3g nutritious chives, 3g minced red pepper, 3g minced red pepper, 10g minced shrimp, 10g flour, 8g water, salt equivalent [mackerel sauce] 2g salted anchovies, 3g water, 2g sugar, 2g sesame salt, 1g red pepper powder, 2g shilpa
rcpNaTip: If the thickness of the kelp is too thin, it is difficult to make pancakes, so choose the right one.

manualSteps.content: 1. Pour enough water to immerse the kelp in a pot, boil it over a medium heat, leave it for about 10 minutes, take it out, soak it in cold water, and cut it into 18cm pieces.
2. Remove the seeds from the green and red peppers and chop the flesh of chives and shrimp.
3. Add water and salt to flour, knead it, add minced vegetables, and mix evenly.
4. Add kelp to 3 and coat it with dough water and coat the pan with oil to make it golden.
5. After cooling the kelp pancake, fix it with a skewer so that it can be rolled up and cut.
6. Cut 5 into 4cm long pieces and add anchovy sauce.

rcpPartsDtls: 15g oyster mushrooms, 15g raw shiitake mushrooms, 15g enoki mushrooms, 15g fresh mushrooms, 15g cucumbers, 15g boiled rice cakes, 8g perilla seeds, 50g water, 2g perilla oil, salt equivalent

manualSteps.content: 1. Rip the oyster mushrooms blanched in boiling water by hand, blanch the raw shiitake mushrooms, squeeze the water, and slice them.
2. Remove the base of the enoki mushrooms and cut them in half, and cut the saesong mushrooms into the size of enoki mushrooms.
3. Peel the rice cakes in water, cut the cucumbers into three halves, cut them obliquely, and drain them in cold water several times.
4. Using a sprayer, perilla seeds are finely ground while adding water little by little, and prepare perilla seed water in a sieve, and discard the waste.
5. Put perilla oil in a pot and stir-fry the cucumbers, pour perilla seed water to boil, then add rice cake and boil.
6. When the rice cake of 5 floats up, add mushrooms, boil them, and season them with salt.

rcpPartsDtls: Onion (10g), chives (3g), lemons (3g), radish leaves (20 pieces), anchovies (7~8), dried seaweed (3g), kelp (5g), rice (210g), kkari pepper (5 pieces), pork (sirloin, 120g), poached egg (1), laver powder (2g), horseradish (2g), garlic (3 pieces), ginger (1tol), dried pepper (3), octagonal (1T), pepper powder (1 ⅓ Ts), cooking oil (20ml)
rcpNaTip: We reduced the use of sodium by grinding anchovies, seaweed, and kelp and seasoning them with natural condiments.

manualSteps.content: 1. Shred onions, chives, lemons, garlic, ginger, and dried peppers.
2. Stir-fry anchovies in a dry pan heated over a medium heat for 3 minutes to dissipate moisture, then place them in a mixer with dried seaweed and kelp and grind them finely.
3. Put cooking oil (20ml) and trimmed spices in a pan heated over a medium heat and stir-fry for 3 minutes to make a fragrance.
4. Add sesame oil, pepper powder, and finely ground anchovy powder to the sperm and mix them evenly.
5. Put the leftover sperm (10g) in a pan heated over a medium heat, add the kkari pepper and pork, and bake for 9 minutes, and cut the pork into bite-sized pieces.
6. Place bibimbap, grilled pork and kkari peppers, trimmed onions, chives, lemon, seaweed flakes, wasabi, radish leaves, and poached eggs in a bowl.

rcpPartsDtls: Potatoes 80g, rice 80g, carrot minced 20g, spinach 20g, small anchovies 5g, boiled egg yolk 5g, black sesame 1g, white sesame 2g [rice seasoning] sesame oil 2g, salt equivalent, white pepper appropriate amount
rcpNaTip: If you purchase and use a shape frame, more shapes are available.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash potatoes clean, steam them in a steamer, peel them, and sieve them.
2. Season the minced carrots while roasting them in an oiled pan, trim and blanch the spinach, rinse it in cold water, squeeze the water, and finely chop it.
3. Saute the small anchovies lightly in the pan and chop them thickly.
4. Put 1, 2, 3, 4 in a bowl, add salt, white pepper powder, and sesame oil and mix.
5. Sift the boiled egg yolk.
6. Form 4 into a circle or triangle and roll evenly over egg yolk, black sesame, and white sesame.

rcpPartsDtls: Sticky rice powder 60g, spinach 30g, chija 5g, edible flower 5g, thyme 5g, sugar 15g, honey 20g
rcpNaTip: The hwajeon dough was flavored and colored using spinach and chimja.

manualSteps.content: 1. Blanch spinach and season it with warm water to grind it finely in a blender.
2. Add the blanched water to finely ground spinach, heat it, and pour it little by little into half of the glutinous rice powder to knead it.
3. Pour the heated dental flakes little by little into the remaining half of the glutinous rice powder and knead it.
4. Let it rest for 30 minutes, then oil the pan and build an appropriate size fire hydrant.
5. When cooking one side, place the flower on top and flip it over and touch it lightly.
6. Boil honey, sugar, and water in a ratio of 1:2:3 to make syrup, sprinkle it on the firework, and decorate it with time.

rcpNm: seaweed fulvescens and rice cake soup
rcpPartsDtls: Joraengi rice cake 140g, seaweed fulvescens 15g, oysters 30g, spring onions 5g, minced garlic 2g, Soup anchovies 3g, soy sauce 1g, salt 0.2g, water 300g
hashTag: a rice cake made with cold and sour sauce
rcpNaTip: When washing seaweed, wash it with a fine sieve or basket to prevent it from flowing down. Since oysters lose nutrients when washed in plain water, remove their skins or stones by washing them lightly, as if rinsing them in cold salt water.

manualSteps.content: 1. Boil 1 cup and a half of water and 1 cup of anchovy soup in a pot.
2. Rinse the seaweed three or four times with water and hold it in a fine sieve to remove moisture.
3. Add salt to the oyster, rub it gently to prevent it from being crushed, rinse it three or four times with water, and support it with a sieve.
4. Slice the spring onions thinly and chop the garlic.
5. Boil the dried seaweed rice cake, seaweed fulvescens, and oysters in anchovy soup.
6. Add green onions and minced garlic, boil them once in a while, season with soy sauce and salt to finish.

rcpPartsDtls: 60g of pickled plum, 15g of pickled plum, 5g of onion, 1g of minced ginger, 1g of garlic, 10g of red pepper paste, 5g of minced garlic, 3g of minced green onions, 2g of soy sauce, 2g of plum extract, 1g of red pepper powder, 15g of water, 0.1g of sesame seeds, 0.1g of pepper powder
rcpNaTip: Gwamegi is cooked without oil on the pan because it has a lot of oil. Since gwamegi is eaten raw, it is grilled only slightly in the pan to the extent that it is coated with the sauce.

manualSteps.content: 1. The gwamegi cuts off its tail.
2. Sprinkle minced ginger and garlic juice over trimmed gwamegi.
3. Make a marinade by mixing red pepper paste, minced garlic, minced green onions, plum juice, red pepper powder, and water.
4. Shred plum pickles.
5. Place the gwamegi in the pan and bake it lightly while applying red pepper paste seasoning.
6. Finish the pickles on the grilled gwamegi.

rcpPartsDtls: Rice 180, cabbage kimchi(stem part) 30, onion 20, raw shiitake mushroom 40, cherry tomato 200, olive oil 12, soy sauce 4, pizza cheese(mozzarella) 30, minced shiitake 5
rcpNaTip: Kimchi is more suitable for fried rice because it can be chewed by using only the white stem. It goes well with sprinkling herbs such as minced parsley or basil instead of green onions.

manualSteps.content: 1. Chop kimchi, onions, and mushrooms.
2. Cut cherry tomatoes into quarters.
3. Put olive oil in a pan and stir-fry kimchi, onion, mushroom, and tomato.
4. Stir-fry rice and season with soy sauce.
5. Put 3 and 4 in a bowl and put pizza cheese on top and cook until the cheese melts in the microwave.
6. Finish by sprinkling shrewd waves.

rcpPartsDtls: Oyster 50, nurungji 50, kelp soup (dry kelp 2, water 450), chives 10, soy sauce 3, sesame oil 2, green laver 0.5
rcpNaTip: Making kelp soup: Boil kelp in cold water for 10 minutes when it becomes soft and use only the soup.

manualSteps.content: 1. Shake oysters in salt water and chop them thickly.
2. Wash the chives and cut them into small pieces.
3. Put kelp soup in nurungji, soak it for 2 minutes, and boil it.
4. When the nurungji is almost spread, add oysters and boil slightly.
5. When the porridge spreads, add leek and boil it for a while.
6. Place in a bowl and crumble the roasted green laver on top.

rcpNm: Grilled pork ribs and braised white kimchi wine
rcpPartsDtls: Main ingredients: 200 pork ribs (70 ribs), water 500, soybean paste 2, green onion 10, ginger 3, olive oil 4, pepper 0.02, salt 0.38 Braised kimchi: white kimchi 60, red wine 40, cooking wine 15, honey 3
rcpNaTip: Using cold white kimchi and leftover wine can reduce food waste. It is delicious to eat it by boiling kimchi and adding grilled ribs to the remaining sauce so that the taste of the sauce permeates the meat.

manualSteps.content: 1. Put water in a pot, release soybean paste, add green onion and ginger, and boil.
2. When the water boils, add pork ribs and boil them for 5 minutes.
3. Cut white kimchi into 5cm long pieces.
4. Put red wine in a pot, put it on a heat to blow away the alcohol, add kimchi, cooking wine, and honey, and boil it down to make it taste better.
5. Sprinkle the boiled back ribs with salt and olive oil and bake them in a pan.
6. Grilled ribs are served with braised white kimchi wine.

rcpPartsDtls: Main ingredients: squid 30, five-grain rice 30, blanched chwinamul 10, soy sauce 3, minced garlic 2.5, pepper 0.01, sesame oil 1 sauce: blanched chwinamul 5, cheongyang red pepper 2, soy sauce 1.5, sesame oil 1, sugar 1, minced garlic 1, soybean paste 0.75
rcpNaTip: If you have leftover chwinamul, you can chop it into small pieces and add it as an ingredient for sundae. It is delicious to add other vegetables such as dried radish greens instead of chwi vegetables. When filling the squid, you have to fill it with a certain amount of space to prevent the filling from bursting when it is steamed.

manualSteps.content: 1. Squid is removed from the legs to remove the intestines and eyes, and the blanched chwinamul is drained and minced.
2. Add chopped chwinamul, soy sauce, garlic, pepper, and sesame oil to the five-grain rice and mix evenly.
3. Add seasoned rice to the squid body and fix the end with a toothpick.
4. Put the squid in a steaming steamer and steam it for 3 minutes.
5. Mix the sauce ingredients to make the Chwinamul soy sauce.
6. Slice the steamed squid sundae, put it on a plate, and serve it with sauce.

rcpPartsDtls: 40g beef fillet, 10g carrots, 10g cucumber pickles, 15g onions, 10g perilla leaves, 50g rice, 6g starch, 2g sesame salt, 2g sesame oil, 2g salt [beef season] soy sauce, 2g rice wine, 1g sesame oil, and pepper powder
rcpNaTip: Be careful because overcooked beef is tough.

manualSteps.content: 1. The beef is sliced into palm-sized pieces with lean meat and marinated in seasoning.
2. Chop carrots and onions and season them with salt while frying them in a pan.
3. Remove the moisture from the cucumber pickles, slice them, and wash the perilla leaves thoroughly to drain them.
4. Cook and season the rice, add the prepared carrots, onions, and cucumber pickles, mix well, and lump them together into bite-sized pieces.
5. Spread the seasoned beef widely, sprinkle starch, and wrap it with perilla leaves and put the prepared rice on top.
6. Put cooking oil on the pan and roll the rolled ssambap until the beef is cooked.

rcpPartsDtls: 30g rice, 3g sesame seeds, 4g whole almonds, 4g peanuts, 4g pumpkin seeds, 90g water, appropriate amount of salt
rcpNaTip: When boiling porridge, you have to put the ground nuts later so that the porridge does not become watery.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash the rice clean and soak it for about five hours.
2. Put the soaked rice in a mortar so that the grains of rice are half-broken.
3. Grind sesame seeds, almonds, peanuts, and pumpkin seeds in a blender.
4. Put rice and water in a pot and boil.
5. When the grains of rice are cooked, add 3 seed powder and boil it.
6. Season with salt and place in a prepared bowl.

rcpPartsDtls: Soaked seaweed (or watery seaweed) 7, spring onions (raw) 10, seaweed 1.3, onion 7, citron syrup 15, water 20, minced green onions 4, minced garlic 1, potato starch 10, egg 7, soybean oil 4
rcpNaTip: If you use soggy seaweed or seaweed, you can reduce food waste.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash seaweed and green onions thoroughly, squeeze water, and chop them into small pieces. Grill seaweed slightly and crumble it.
2. Chop the onion and citron syrup into small pieces.
3. Combine 1 and 2, add potato starch and eggs and knead.
4. Squeeze the dough into a circle and fry it in oil.
5. Mix the water with the citron syrup and boil it thickly to make the sauce.
6. Serve seaweed fries with sauce.

rcpPartsDtls: Walnuts 15, olive oil 4, tteokbokki rice cake 80, oligosaccharide 20, soy sauce 1.5, black sesame (fried) 0.5
rcpNaTip: When roasting rice cakes, you have to stir-fry them over low heat to prevent the soy sauce from burning. It is delicious if honey is added instead of oligosaccharide.

manualSteps.content: 1. Cut walnuts into thick pieces.
2. Stir-fry minced walnuts lightly in a dry pan.
3. Grease the pan and stir-fry until the rice cakes are tender.
4. When the rice cake is cooked, add oligosaccharide and soy sauce and stir-fry slightly.
5. Add walnuts and stir-fry a little more to blend the taste.
6. Sprinkle black sesame to complete it.

rcpPartsDtls: Main ingredients: rice 90, bean sprouts 30, boiled bamboo shoots 40, green tea Korean water 90 Seasoning: soy sauce 4, red pepper powder 0.5, sugar 1, sesame salt 0.5, minced green onion 2.5, minced garlic 1.25, cheongyang red pepper 2.5, cooking wine 3.75, sesame oil 1
rcpNaTip: Boil raw bamboo shoots in rice water for 10 minutes and grind them in half length to remove the lime stuck in them. When there is no raw bamboo shoots, use a can of bamboo shoots lightly blanched in boiling water. If bean sprouts are laid at the bottom of the pot, it is easy to match the rice water. Since moisture comes out from bamboo shoots and bean sprouts, adjust the rice water to 2/3 of the usual amount.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash the bean sprouts clean and take off the tail.
2. Cut bamboo shoots thinly into bite-sized pieces using comb patterns.
3. Mix all the ingredients of the sauce to make the sauce.
4. Put washed rice in a pot, put bean sprouts and bamboo shoots, and green tea we pour water to make rice.
5. When the rice is done, let it slow down.
6. Mix the rice and mix it with the sauce.

rcpPartsDtls: Bibimbap: Rice 210, sea squirt 50, chives 10, radish leaves 5, seaweed 0.5, sesame oil 4, sesame seeds 1.5 Seasoning: red pepper paste 5, sugar 1, lemon juice 3, ground onion 3, plum extract 3
rcpNaTip: It is delicious to chop sea squirt meat, put it in the freezer, freeze it slightly, and put it in. • When the scent of sea squirt is strong, the strong scent is reduced by mixing it with crown daisy.

manualSteps.content: 1. Pick the top of the sea squirt, peel it, and cut it into bite-sized pieces.
2. Cut chives into 2cm long pieces.
3. Shred the seaweed into the same length as the chives.
4. Mix all the ingredients of the sauce to make the sauce.
5. Add sesame oil to the trimmed sea squirt and mix lightly.
6. Put rice in a bowl, put chives, radish leaves, sea squirt, seaweed, and sesame seeds, and mix them with sauce.

rcpPartsDtls: Flounder 50, ramie shell 15, mugwort 20, water 200, soybean paste 9, green onion 4, perilla powder 6
rcpNaTip: If you add a flounder instead of flounder, the taste is lighter.

manualSteps.content: 1. Remove scales, intestines, and fins and divide them into three halves.
2. Put soybean paste in water and boil it.
3. Add flounder and ramie shell and boil for another 20 minutes.
4. Add mugwort and boil it for 5 minutes.
5. Add green onion and perilla powder and boil it slightly.
6. Put flounder and mugwort in a bowl first, pour the soup next to it, and put it in.

rcpPartsDtls: Main ingredients: flour 50, water 25, clam 100, onion 20, garlic 5, Cheongyang red pepper 5, shilpa 5, soybean oil 4, cooking wine 5, sesame oil 2 marinade: water 25, oyster sauce 1.5, soy sauce 1, plum extract 1.5, fish sauce 1
rcpNaTip: Make sujebi dough, wrap it in plastic wrap, and ripen for about 30 minutes It is more chewy when used. Making leftover sujebi dough reduces food waste and saves time.

manualSteps.content: 1. Add water to flour and make sujebi dough.
2. Remove the dough from the boiling water and cook it and support it in a sieve.
3. Chop the onion thickly, slice the garlic on one side, and slice the cheongyang red pepper diagonally.
4. Mix a lot of ingredients to make the sauce.
5. Add oil to the pan and stir-fry garlic, then stir-fry with clams and cooking wine.
6. Stir-fry onion and cheongyang red pepper, then stir-fry slightly with sauce, sujebi, and sesame oil.

rcpPartsDtls: Chalk 70g, soy sauce 1.5g, salt 0.5g, minced green onions 2.25g, minced garlic 1g, perilla oil 3g, perilla seed powder 6g
rcpNaTip: Young chwinamul is used as the stem, and old chwinamul is used only by removing the stem.

manualSteps.content: 1. Blanch the chwi greens slightly in boiling water.
2. Rinse the blanched chwinamul in cold water.
3. Squeeze the chwinamool lightly, remove the water, and cut it into 5cm lengths.
4. Mix all the rest of the ingredients and prepare the sauce.
5. Put the chwi namul in a bowl and add the sauce and mix it up.
6. Finish with the seasoned herbs in a bowl.

rcpPartsDtls: Main ingredients: green garlic 20, water 200, dried squid 5 seasoning: flour 1.25, water 20, salt 0.25, red pepper powder 0.6, salted shrimp 0.75, anchovy sauce 0.2g, sugar 1, sesame 0.5, ginger juice 0.25
rcpNaTip: If you add flour to the sour green garlic kimchi and pancake, it becomes a delicious pancake without adding other ingredients.

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash the green garlic clean and cut it into 5cm long pieces.
2. Soak green garlic in water for about 30 minutes to remove the spiciness.
3. Cut squid into 1cm x 5cm pieces.
4. Combine flour and water and cool down the grass over low heat.
5. Mix the rest of the marinade ingredients in the grass.
6. Mix green garlic and squid with sauce and eat them on the spot or lightly cooked.

rcpNm: Soft tofu, soft tofu, and soft cold soup
rcpPartsDtls: 75g soft tofu, 10g radish, 5g green onion, 3g green pepper, 3g red pepper, 2g mugwort, 1g sesame seeds, 90g salt equivalent [cold soup ingredients] kelp broth, 4g soy sauce, 2g cooking wine, 2g vinegar, 3g sugar
rcpNaTip: Soft tofu looks good when it is shaped round and pretty with an ice cream ladle.

manualSteps.content: 1. Remove the blemishes of radish leaves, shake them in water, and drain them.
2. Divide soft tofu into appropriate sizes.
3. Mix the kelp stock with a large amount of ingredients to make a cold soup soup, and put it in the refrigerator to make it cold.
4. Chop the blue, red pepper, and green onion into 2cm long pieces.
5. Put 2 soft tofu in a bowl of cold soup and place radish leaves, shredded green onions, green onions, and red peppers neatly.
6. Pour the cold soup soup prepared on the soft tofu of 5, put crown daisy on top, and sprinkle sesame seeds.

rcpPartsDtls: Ingredients for one serving Spring Dong 10g, sesame leaves 6g, octopus legs 6g, sesame oil 3g knee 8g, olive oil 4g, water parsley 3g rice balls blanched cockles 12g, olive oil 4g, rice 100g, sesame seeds 3g tofu soy sauce sesame oil 10g, minced onions 14g, minced carrots 14g, minced zucchini 14g, water 150g, soybean paste 14g, red pepper 4g, minced garlic 4g
rcpNaTip: Sodium intake can be reduced by allowing rice balls to be dipped without sauce. In addition, tofu was added to the strong soybean paste to reduce sodium content.

manualSteps.content: 1. Blanch spring dongs and perilla leaves and drain them with a sieve.
2. Remove the water from the blanched cockle, mix it with sesame seeds in rice seasoned with olive oil, and make a bite-sized rice ball.
3. After cooling the leg of octopus in dethcher cold water, season it in sesame oil (3g), blanch the mixture, remove the water, and season it with olive oil.
4. Put cockle rice in spring-dong, wrap it with leaves, and tie it with blanched water parsley to make spring rice.

5. Put sesame oil in a pot and stir-fry onions, carrots, and zucchini, then add water, soybean paste, red pepper, minced garlic, red pepper, cheongyang red pepper, and tofu to make tofu strong soybean paste.
6. Spring rice balls are finished with octopus, sea urchin, and tofu soy sauce.

rcpPartsDtls: Brown rice (100g), tote (30g), shape (5g), egg (50g), sesame oil (4g), sesame (2g), tote seasoned seasoning sugar (2g), vinegar (2g)
rcpNaTip: rice balls made with brown rice and tots coated with egg water and baked delicacies

manualSteps.content: 1. After cooking rice with brown rice, add seasoning to the rice and mix.
2. Mix the tote with the tote seasoning.
3. Add tots to rice and mix.
4. After rounding the rice into a good size to eat, coat it evenly with the broken shape.
5. Coat the rice balls with egg water.
6. Grill it in the pan to finish.

rcpPartsDtls: rice (200g), perilla leaf pickles (30g), laver (5g), sprouts (20g), sesame oil (5g), sesame seeds (3g), herb tartare dressing onions (20g), pickles (20g), boiled eggs (60g), mayonnaise (20g), mustard sauce sugar (3g), water (5g), mustard jos (1.5g)
rcpNaTip: An excellent dish that reduces sodium by making a filling with boiled eggs and onions and making rolls with rice and perilla leaf pickles

manualSteps.content: 1. Wash the rice, cook it, and season it.
2. Onions, pickles, and boiled eggs are minced and mixed with mayonnaise to make herb tartare dressing.
3. Spread the rice on the seaweed, put the herb tartare dressing on top, and roll it up.

6. Each serving is cooked to a golden age.

rcpNm: Gosari pajeon and sweet potato pancakes
rcpPartsDtls: 30g of bracken, 7g of chives, 6g of red pepper, 20g of eggs (0.3), 20g of flour, 13g of sweet persimmons, 30ml of water, 15g of glutinous rice flour, 50g of potato starch, 0.1g of jujube
rcpNaTip: We reduced the use of sodium by utilizing the chewy texture and unique scent of bracken.

manualSteps.content: 1. Cut the bracken and chives in half, and cut the red pepper into long pieces.
2. Place ① on an oiled pan and pour out the flour and egg batter.
3. Cut the sweet persimmons into 0.4cm circles and cut them into flower-shaped molds.
4. Add potato starch to glutinous rice powder and knead it.
5. Round the dough in an oiled pan and pour over the persimmon and jujube flowers.
6. Put sweet persimmon pancake and sweet-sized bracken green onion pancake into a bowl to complete.

rcpPartsDtls: 30g seaweed fulvescens, 10g clamshells, 5g pancake powder, 5g frying powder, 1g red pepper, 12g soybean oil
rcpNaTip: Clams and seaweed fulvescens are rich in potassium, which helps in the release of sodium.

manualSteps.content: 1. Seaweed and clams are rinsed in water several times to remove saltiness.
2. Add water to the frying powder and pancake powder and make the dough.
3. Finely chop the seaweed and mix it into the dough.
4. Place seaweed fulvescens dough on a pan, add clams, and bake until golden.
5. Add red pepper garnish before baking.
6. Put it in a bowl and finish.

rcpPartsDtls: 10g chickpeas, 10g black beans, 10g peas, 25g tofu, 5g red paprika, 10g glutinous rice flour, 5g flour, 0.3g salt, 2ml water, 10g cooking oil
rcpNaTip: You can use soy products rich in potassium to reduce sodium absorption in your body.

manualSteps.content: 1. Cut paprika into bean-sized cubes.
2. After soaking the prepared beans in water, boil each in boiling water and drain.
3. Crush tofu and boiled chickpeas.
4. Add flour, sticky rice powder, salt, and water to ③ and knead.
5. Mix beans and paprika in dough.
6. Put cooking oil on the pan and send it in a good size to see the beans in the dough.

rcpNm: Sweet potato sprouts perilla seed sprouts
rcpPartsDtls: Sweet potato pure 60g, perilla seed powder 20g, kelp 2g, salt 1g, sesame oil 2g
rcpNaTip: Sweet potato shoots, which are high in potassium, help release sodium.

manualSteps.content: 1. Boil sweet potato shoots in boiling water and wash them.
2. Boil water and kelp over low heat for about 10 minutes and add water again.
3. Transfer the sweet potato shoots to a pan and boil them again with water.
4. When the water is reduced by half again, add salt and perilla powder.
5. Stir-fry it so that it doesn't get wet, then add sesame oil.
6. Put it on a plate and complete it.

rcpPartsDtls: Abalone (2), zucchini (20g), shiitake mushrooms (15g), carrot (20g), egg garnish (one sheet each white, one sheet each), boiled rice noodles (80g), cooking oil (5ml), anchovies (5g), dried pollack (2g), kelp (3g), green onion (100g), whole pepper (2g), red pepper powder (3g), soy sauce (5g), vinegar (2g), minced garlic (1g), sesame oil (1g)
rcpNaTip:
We reduced the use of salt by using anchovy sauce.
Stir-fried anchovies and dried pollack over low heat improves the flavor.

manualSteps.content: 1. Stir-fry anchovies and dried pollack for 5 minutes on low heat, add the rest of the broth and water (1L) and boil for 30 minutes, then sift through a sieve.
2. Chop the dried anchovies into small pieces, remove the skin and intestines of abalone, add the sheath, and shred the zucchini, shiitake mushrooms, carrots, and egg garnish.
3. Make an anchovy sauce by adding anchovy sauce ingredients to finely chopped anchovies.
4. Pour the stock into a pot and cook for 5 minutes by adding the trimmed abalone over low heat.
5. Put cooking oil (5ml) on a pan heated over a medium heat and stir-fry the trimmed vegetables.
6. Put the boiled noodles in a bowl → stir-fried ingredients → cooked abalone in order and pour the broth.

rcpPartsDtls:
•Must-have ingredients: dried seaweed (2g), bonito fish cloth (0.3g)
•Seasoning: Miso soy sauce (3g), flavorful (0.3g), water (350g)
rcpNaTip: •The broth brewed with dried bonito is seasoned even without salt.

manualSteps.content: 1. Dried seaweed is soaked in water.
2. Chop the soaked seaweed into small pieces.
3. Put water (350g) and bonito in a pot to make broth.
4. Beat the miso paste in the broth.
5. Add seaweed to the soup and boil it.
6. Finish by adding the flavor of rice.

rcpPartsDtls: 50g mussels, 50g cabbages, 30g radishes, 2g garlic, 3g green onions, 1g red pepper, 0.3g salt
rcpNaTip: You can create the natural taste of the ingredients by making cool water with the umami and vegetables of mussels.

manualSteps.content: 1. Add sliced radish into a bite-sized piece of boiling water.
2. When the radish becomes transparent, add cabbage and boil it.
3. Add mussels.
4. When a mussel opens its mouth, it condiments with minced garlic.
5. Add salt.
6. Garnish with sliced spring onions and red pepper.

rcpPartsDtls: Bean sprouts 50g, pollack head 40g, red pepper paste 10g, flour 100g, red pepper powder 5g, salt 2g
rcpNaTip: If you grill the pollack head and use it, you can make a broth that is at least delicious with sodium.

manualSteps.content: 1. Mix the flour with salt, knead it, and ripen it.
2. After roasting the pollack head, boil it in cold water to make broth and filter it with gauze.
3. Pour 2 broth into a pot, add 1/2 bean sprouts, and when it boils, add red pepper paste and red pepper powder and boil.
4. Push the aged sujebi dough and boil it in boiling water separately.
5. Add 4 sujebi to 3 and boil it a little.
6. Add the rest of the bean sprouts to complete it.

rcpPartsDtls: [4 servings] Seaweed stalks (1 pack = 300g), onions (1 ½), crab meat (135g), dried shrimp (1 cup), pancake powder (1 cup), fried ½ powder (1 cup), carbonated water (1 cup), avocado oil (1 Ts)
rcpNaTip:
•The seaweed stem was dipped in water and the crab meat was blanched to reduce the sodium content.
•We used onions to sweeten and reduce the use of added sugar.

manualSteps.content: 1. Rinse seaweed stalks several times in running water and soak them in cold water for about an hour.
2. Cut seaweed stalks into bite-sized pieces, shred onions thinly, and cut crab meat into pieces.
3. Blanch the crab meat slightly in boiling water and remove the water.
4. Mix the dough ingredients evenly, then add the trimmed ingredients and mix roughly.
5. Put avocado oil on a pan heated over a medium heat, remove the dough to an appropriate size, and top with dried shrimp.
6. When the dough becomes opaque, turn it over and bake it back and forth until golden.
